title_en: In the UK, the workers of the nuclear submarine base have planned a strike
summary_en:
More than 600 workers of Babcock Marine Ltd are planning a strike at the Clyde strategic submarine base.
The workers demand fair pay and point to the company's ability to offer a decent offer.
Employees were offered a salary increase, which in real terms means a significant reduction.
The British Ministry of Defense has signed a contract with Babcock Marine for the maintenance of nuclear weapons and the strategic arms support building.
Four British Vanguard-class strategic nuclear submarines are stationed at the Clyde base.
In Finland, the work of all Finnish ports was stopped due to a strike of workers who opposed the reforms of the Cabinet of Ministers in the labor market.
The actions covered about 7 thousand people, including the trade unions of motor transport workers, the industrial trade union and the electricians' union.

title: "–ú–∞—Å—Å–æ–≤–æ–µ –ø—Ä–æ–¥–æ–ª–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ" –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫–∏ –ø–æ—á—Ç–∞–ª—å–æ–Ω–æ–≤ –≤ –ê–ª—å–±–∞—Å–µ—Ç–µ: "–û–Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—à–ª–∞ —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω–æ"
title_en: "Massive continuation" of the Albacete postmen's strike: "It was successful"
summary_en:
The mass strike of postmen in Albacete was successful.
Trade unions have secured the support of 90% of employees in the capital and 100% in other localities.
The strike condemns the shortage of staff in the distribution units of Albacete and other cities.
Lack of staff leads to excessive overload and terrible working conditions.
The economic situation of Postos has led to "severe staff cuts."
The lack of coverage for absence from work causes disruptions in the postal service and delays in the delivery of correspondence.
Workers and female employees gathered at the doors of the post offices, expressing dissatisfaction with the unstable situation.
UGT Public Services highlights the critical and volatile situation in the province of Albacete.
The personnel policy does not cover the absence of employees, which leads to overload and psychophysical stress for employees.
UGT considers it necessary for the Post Office to take immediate measures to resolve the situation and ensure the proper provision of the service.
